message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.IR 

This paper deals with the problem of action recognition in videos, which is a core problem in computer vision. The paper proposes a reinforcement learning-based approach to learn from noisy web videos, which involves both computer vision and machine learning techniques. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also involves the use of Q-learning, which is a popular reinforcement learning algorithm, suggesting that cs.LG (Machine Learning) is another likely sub-category. The paper also deals with learning from web data, which involves information retrieval and web search, suggesting that cs.IR (Information Retrieval) is another possible sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves the use of deep learning models, suggesting that cs.MM (Multimedia) is another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper involves the use of semi-supervised and webly-supervised learning, suggesting that cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is another possible sub-category.
